data.author: Ankush Verma
data.content: Russia on Saturday said that it had destroyed a major consignment of Western arms in Ukraine's Zhytomyr region using sea-launched Kalibr cruise missiles. The strike took out "a large batch of weapons and military equipment delivered from the USA and European countries" and intended for Ukrainian troops, it further said.
data.title: Russia says it destroyed large weapons consignment from US, Europe in Ukraine

data.author: Daisy Mowke
data.content: Australian Opposition leader Anthony Albanese is set to become the country's Prime Minister as Scott Morrison admitted defeat in national elections on Saturday. "I've always believed in Australians and their judgment, and I've always been prepared to accept their verdict," said Morrison. Morrison also said he would stand down as leader of the Liberal party.
data.title: Australian PM Morrison concedes defeat in general election, Anthony Albanese to take over

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: US President Joe Biden on Saturday said America had offered North Korea and China COVID-19 vaccines but "got no response". North Korea, which reported its first outbreak of COVID-19 earlier this month, has recorded nearly 25 lakh "fever" cases and 66 deaths despite a "maximum emergency" epidemic campaign. North Korea is yet to start a mass vaccination campaign against COVID-19.
data.title: Offered COVID-19 vaccines to North Korea, got no response: US

data.author: Ankush Verma
data.content: A 21-year-old Russian soldier told a court that he "sincerely repented" killing an unarmed 62-year-old civilian in the northeast Ukrainian village of Chupakhivka on February 28. "I was nervous at the time, I did not want to kill...that's how it happened," Vadim Shishimarin said. Shishimarin is accused of firing several shots with an assault rifle at the civilian's head.
data.title: I did not want to kill, I was nervous: Russian soldier who killed 62-year-old Ukrainian

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday congratulated Anthony Albanese, who is set to be Australia's next PM, for securing a victory in the Australian national election. "I look forward to working towards further strengthening our Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, and for shared priorities in the Indo-Pacific region," he tweeted. PM Modi also congratulated Albanese for Labor Party's win in the election.
data.title: Look forward to strengthening our ties: PM Modi to Aus PM-elect

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: Authorities in Dominica have discontinued the proceedings against fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi over his 'illegal entry' into the island nation, officials said on Saturday. Choksi, who is wanted in connection to the ₹13,500 crore Punjab National Bank fraud case, had claimed he was abducted from Antigua and Barbuda and taken to Dominica against his will.
data.title: Dominica withdraws case against Mehul Choksi over 'illegal entry'

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: During an interview, when asked if it is safe for tourists to visit Sri Lanka, PM Ranil Wickremesinghe joked that tourists who "want to have an exciting" time can come. He added, "Maybe they could take part in the demonstration" or hold placards against the President. Meanwhile, the journalist remarked that his question on tourism was a serious one.
data.title: 'Tourists who want an exciting time can come', jokes Sri Lanka PM; video viral

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: More than 80 cases of monkeypox have been confirmed in at least 12 countries so far. Infections have been confirmed in nine European countries, as well as the US, Canada and Australia. Public health agencies in Europe have confirmed cases in UK, Spain, Portugal, Germany, Belgium, France, Netherlands, Italy and Sweden. There are now 20 confirmed cases in UK.
data.title: Which countries have reported cases of monkeypox so far?

data.author: Anmol Sharma
data.content: A topless woman crashed the Cannes Film Festival 2022 red carpet to protest against sexual violence in Ukraine. The woman appeared to be wearing body paint in the colours of the flag of Ukraine. She was heard screaming 'Stop raping us' as she was escorted off the red carpet by the security personnel.
data.title: Topless woman crashes Cannes to protest against sexual violence in Ukraine

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: Former US President Donald Trump has paid a $110,000 (over ₹85 lakh) fine after being held in contempt of court. The New York Attorney General's office moved to hold Trump in contempt for not handing over business-related documents for a probe. The office is investigating whether the Trump Organization falsely reported property values to secure loans and obtain tax benefits.
data.title: Trump pays over ₹85 lakh fine after being held in contempt of court

data.author: Ridham Gambhir
data.content: The Sri Lankan government on Saturday lifted the state of emergency, nearly two weeks after it was imposed amid anti-government protests over the nation's worst economic crisis. As per the authorities, the move was taken with the improvement of the law and order situation. President Gotabaya Rajapaksa had declared a state of emergency with effect from May 6 midnight.
data.title: Sri Lanka lifts state of emergency after 2 weeks as law & order situation improves

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy proposed a formal deal with the country's allies to obtain Russian compensation for the damage caused by its forces during war. Under the deal, Russian funds and property in signatory nations will be seized and directed to a special compensation fund, he added. "Russia will feel...weight of every missile...bomb...which it has fired at us," he said.
data.title: Zelenskyy proposes deal to secure Russian compensation for invasion

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Saturday said that it has banned 963 US citizens from entering Russia so far. The West and Russia began to impose travel bans on individuals since the start of war in Ukraine on February 24. The ministry also said that it would continue to retaliate against what it called hostile US actions.
data.title: 963 Americans banned from entering Russia so far: Russian ministry

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: Representatives from the US and four other countries on Saturday staged a walkout when a Russian representative began his opening remarks at a meeting of trade ministers of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation group in Bangkok, officials said. The walkout was "an expression of disapproval at Russia's illegal war...in Ukraine and its economic impact in the APEC region", a diplomat said.
data.title: US, other APEC delegates walk out on Russian speaker

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the war in Ukraine "will be bloody, there will be fighting but will only definitively end through diplomacy". Negotiations between Russia and Ukraine are at a standstill, with both nations accusing each other of intransigence. "We want everything to return [to as it was before]" but "Russia doesn't want that", Zelenskyy added without elaborating.
data.title: Only diplomacy can end Ukraine war: Zelenskyy

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: UK's Defence Ministry said Russian forces in Ukraine are likely experiencing a shortage of appropriate reconnaissance Uncrewed Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), used to "identify targets to be struck by combat jets or artillery". "If Russia continues to lose UAVs at...current rate, Russian forces...reconnaissance capability will be further degraded, negatively impacting operational effectiveness," it added.
data.title: Russia likely facing Uncrewed Aerial Vehicles shortage: UK

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: India on Saturday supplied another 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel to Sri Lanka amid an economic crisis in the country. Last month, India extended an additional $500 million credit line to help Sri Lanka import fuel. Separately, India's High Commission on Friday said that a ship carrying rice, milk powder and medicines from India will reach Sri Lanka on Sunday.
data.title: India supplies another 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel to Sri Lanka

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Saturday discussed his concerns with Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson and Finnish President Sauli Niinistö after objecting to Sweden and Finland joining NATO. Turkey has claimed that Sweden and Finland harbour people linked to a Kurdish militant group and followers of Fethullah Gulen, whom the Turkish government accuses of orchestrating a 2016 coup attempt.
data.title: Turkey holds talks with Sweden, Finland amid their bid to join NATO

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: Pakistan's ex-federal minister Shireen Mazari was arrested in Islamabad over a decades-old land grabbing allegation, her family said. Mazari's daughter tweeted, "Male police officers have beaten and taken my mother away. All I've been told is that Anti Corruption Wing Lahore has taken her." Notably, Islamabad High Court has ordered Mazari to be produced before it at 11:30 pm tonight.
data.title: Ex-Pak minister Mazari beaten, taken into police custody: Family

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: Fifty-seven US lawmakers have called on the FBI to investigate the killing of Al Jazeera reporter Shireen Abu Akleh. She was shot dead during an Israeli military raid in West Bank on May 11. "As an American...Abu Akleh was entitled to...full protections afforded to US citizens living abroad," lawmakers wrote to State Secretary Antony Blinken and FBI Director Christopher Wray.
data.title: 57 US lawmakers seek FBI probe into killing of Al Jazeera journalist

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez has confirmed that she is engaged to her longtime partner Riley Roberts. "We got engaged last month in my family's hometown in Puerto Rico...No future details yet, we're taking some space to savour this time before diving into planning," she said. The pair had met when they were undergraduate students at Boston University.
data.title: US lawmaker Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez announces her engagement

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: UK PM Boris Johnson's father, Stanley Johnson, has secured French citizenship. "This decision concerns...Stanley Johnson only and doesn't extend to his descendants," French Justice Ministry said. The development means that the 81-year-old, whose mother was French, will retain all the rights of EU citizenship that British citizens lost after Brexit. He doesn't have to give up his UK nationality.
data.title: UK PM Boris Johnson's father becomes French citizen

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: Speaking on a potential meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, US President Joe Biden has said, "It would depend on whether he was sincere and whether he was serious." Biden made the comment during his visit to South Korea. Notably, Biden's predecessor Donald Trump had met Kim three times, before diplomatic talks between the two countries ended in 2019.
data.title: Any meeting with Kim Jong-un would depend on sincerity, says Biden

data.author: Athira Sasidharan
data.content: A tornado swept through parts of western Germany on Friday injuring around 40 people, "10 of them seriously", police said. The tornado damaged several homes, disrupted traffic and uprooted trees that toppled onto rail tracks and roads. The German Weather Service has warned that the stormy weather was set to continue. Police have asked locals to stay at home.
data.title: 40 people injured, houses damaged as tornado hits Germany

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: US President Joe Biden on Saturday signed a bill to provide nearly $40 billion in aid for Ukraine in its fight against Russia, the White House announced. The legislation includes $20 billion in military assistance and $8 billion in general economic support. Notably, Biden signed the bill while visiting South Korea on his first trip to Asia as the President.
data.title: Prez Biden signs $40 billion aid bill for Ukraine's war effort
